title: (x) Discover Upnorth 2K Tee design - Futura Extrabold ICG {Justin Kay}
content:
Hi,  
Does anyone know what this typeface used is?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20101019055613im_/http:/typophile.com/files/2k_5672.jpg)
  
Thanks in advance!
author: Seadreams

comments.content:
That looks like Futura Extra Bold

Nick Cooke
Hey, I thought so. I tried it on my computer but it seems a tad different. Maybe a different digitization?
Looks like Futura to me as well, but that G is decidedly not Futura.
Nice catch. I hadn't noticed how similar this was to Futura X-Bold.

Nah, look at the 'C'. The sample is definitely Futura-based at least.

- Lex

It could just be a fold in the shirt or something.

- Lex

If it wasn't for the G, i'd say Futura xtrabold from Scangraphic. But it isn't. And if it were wider, it'd be Flyer. But it ain't.

Too late to browse the Big Yellow Book.

Hrmph. I think it is more than likely Scangraphic Futura X-Bold. It has more in common and is the correct weight. I rescind my "nice catch" statement. If you stare at the G long enough, the bottom is flat and ill-shaped. Mea culpa.
futura x-bold from an old collection i have from ICG. i searched high and low to find the one that matched the old lubalin work and that was the only one that had that "G".
[Futura No2 Extra Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20101019055613/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/futura-no-2/futura-no2-d-extra-bold/) released by URW in 1993 also seems to sport that alternate G.

Well, Sebastian, that is really good. The W has the high crotch as well as the O have the small counter.

Justin do you not have a sample?
Does anyone know if the ICG version is available for sale anywhere?
Wow. That version is even fatter than the URW version.
